summary: With a background in computational mathematics and geo-engineering I aim to address the next generation of modeling challenges, solving problems with societal, economic, and environmental impacts. Moreover, being a senior software developer as well as a lecturer and supervisor for MSc students, I have acquired useful skills such as team management and knowledge transfer. Combining the practical tools, I hope I contribute to shaping a better future.

- Scientific Computing (2019-2020 and 2020-2021)', 'title': 'Lecturer', 'employment_type': 'Contract'}, {'location': 'Delft Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Delft University of Technology', 'description': 'Development of fully 3D generalized Embedded Discrete Fracture Model (EDFM).', 'title': 'Research Assistant at DARSim', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Delft Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Delft University of Technology', 'description': 'Teaching Assistant at course AES2009 Field Development Project:
This course is taught to 2nd year MSc students of petroleum engineering by a group of professors and four teaching assistants. During this intensive all-in-one course (9 ECTs), students have to work (in groups) on the seismic and petrophysics data of Tern Oil-field located at UK section of North Sea (block number 210/25), build a geological model, generate input for simulation and design a production scenario with financial analysis for the life-time of the reservoir. Each group will establish a virtual oil company as the main investor on this project. Students work with a number of software such as Petrel, Eclipse, MATLAB, Questor and Microsoft Office to achieve their goals. A final presentation will mark the ending point of the course.


Teaching Assistant of course AES1310 Rock Fluid Physics:
This course contains the fundamental physics of rock-fluid interactions, fluid flow in porous media and pore-scale analysis.


Grader of course AES1350 Reservoir Simulation:
In the course, students will be introduced to the concept of reservoir simulation. They will learn how to model a reservoir with help of numerical approximations and they will use a number of numerical approaches. As assessment, They are tasked to build simulators and numerical solvers for 1D/2D samples of porous media both for in-compressible and compressible fluid. Their final simulator (IMPES) should be capable of solving pressure and saturation equations sequentially.', 'title': 'Graduate Teaching Assistant', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'The Hague Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'Delft University of Technology', 'description': None, 'title': 'MSc Petroleum Engineering Student', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Special Tution Center for Pre-University Students', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Tehran, Iran', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'Special Tution Center for Pre-University Students', 'description': 'I had taught high school and pre-university students in order to prepare them for National University Entrance Exam for more than 4 years.
